intro: Hieracium lasium, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas, meadows, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, and its leaves are lance-shaped with hairy surfaces. Hieracium lasium is often found in open habitats and can be a common sight in temperate regions.
